10.1109/BigData.2017.8258402.title: Understanding rating behavior based on moral foundations: The case of Yelp reviews
10.1109/BigData.2017.8258402.author: Nokhiz, Pegah and Li, Fengjun
10.1109/BigData.2017.8258402.paperMotivationText: Moral inclinations expressed in user-generated content such as online reviews can provide useful insight to understand and predict people's rating behavior.
10.1109/BigData.2017.8258402.paperContributionText: Based on cosine similarity of document-level embeddings (no fine-tuning involved), the authors determine the moral foundations in Yelp reviews and analyze their relationship to user rating behaviours.
10.1109/BigData.2017.8258402.paperResultsText: Rating behaviours of regular and moral-concerned reviewers on Yelp differ from each other. People with moral concerns tend to rate lower if a moral foundation is violated. Purity is the most distinctive moral foundation.
